Judul: ALPHA-GLUCOSIDASE INHIBITOR ACTIVITY AND REVIEW OF SELECTED PLANTS FROM ACANTHACEAE FAMILY
Abstrak:
Diabetes Mellitus (DM) is characterized by a complete lack of insulin, a relative lack of
insulin, or insulin resistance as well as disorders of other hormones. These defects result in
an inability to use glucose for energy. There were over 10,276,100 cases of diabetes in

to observe alpha-glucosidase inhibitor activity and to explore the phytochemical and
pharmacological activities of Andrographis paniculata, Clinacanthus nutans, Hemigraphis
alternata, Strobilanthes crispus and Ruellia tuberosa L. from Acanthaceae family based on
literature review.The extraction was done by maceration using ethanol (96% v/v). The
Literature review was done by using an electronic database from academic journal, Pubmed,
Springerlink and Elsevier. The web filter search using google scholar were attempted by
applying Andrographis paniculata, Clinacanthus nutans, Hemigraphis alternata,
Strobilanthes crispus , Ruellia tuberosa L., anti-diabetic, anti-inflammatory, antioxidant and

linalool, quercetin, limonene, alpha-glucosidase inhibitor as keywords. Based on
phytochemical screening, all of selected plants contained flavonoid and tannin. From the
literature review it showed that they consisted various phytochemical compounds in the
leaves and they contributed to many biological activities (anti-inflammatory, antioxidant
and anti-bacterial activity). They are quercetin, limonene, linalool, stigmasterol, lupeol and
?-linolenic acid. One of the isolated compounds from Andrographis paniculata is
Andrographolide, it belongs to labdane diterpene. It showed alpha-glucosidase inhibitor
activity which delay the absorption of carbohydrates in small intestine, thus lowering the
blood glucose level in body. Based on experiment, cannot determine whether all plants have
alpha-glucosidase inhibitor activity because limitation of time. However, according to
